name: testable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be proved by testing: Any experiment in science needs a testable hypothesis. Some testable theories, when found to be false, are still upheld by their admirers.
able to be tested: No testable evidence was provided. The challenge was to get testable samples of the odour from which to measure and interpret data. Compare
untestable
More examplesFewer examplesThe claims that God does exist and that God does not exist are not testable.One criticism of the Economic Theory of Regulation is that it lacks sufficient structure to make it testable.Their discussion is important because it provides a testable model of personality.Some of the ideas may not be easily testable.
